data.title: Which table stores DistNumber for Deliveries?

qas.question: I have built a report that allows for a wildcard or short term search for our deliveries. One element I am missing is DistNumber on the order line. I am unsure which table this is stored in so I can recall this in the query. I know that OBTN is the primary table for batch information. However I don't think this is the properly linked table for order-specific (ORDR or ODLN) selections. SELECT T0."DocEntry" AS "(Delivery Link)", T0."BaseDocNum" AS "SO Number", T1."DocDate", T1."CardCode" AS "Customer #", T1."CardName" AS "Customer Name", T0."ItemCode", T0."Dscription", T0."Quantity", T0."U_PricePerLB", T0."U_PriceperKG", T0."LineTotal", T0."WhsCode" AS "Whs", T1."TrnspCode", FROM DLN1 T0 INNER JOIN ODLN T1 ON T0."DocEntry" = T1."DocEntry" WHERE T0."ItemCode" Like '%%[%0]%%' AND T0."Dscription" Like '%%[%1]%%' AND T1."CardName" Like '%%[%2]%%'

Excise Capture done and pending for Excise Posting Please guide Regards,

data.title: COPA (which value fields to use for costs )

qas.question: Hi All, I am not sure which one set of value fields to use for collecting costs in COPA reports/ 1: Value field attached to Condition type VPRS ( thru tran 2: Sum up all value fields attached to cost component structure ( costs coming from PC thru costing key ) Which is more accurate or which is appropriate to use. Regards, Reddy

answers.text: Hi Reddy, The value that is shown in VPRS is nothing but the std cost estimate if price control is "S" for that material and you have a valid release std cost estimate. So you dont need to take the total of all cost components to get the std cost estimate in COPA. Just assign VPRS to your value field, that should be enough. Regards, Suraj

data.title: Which of these statements about overhead rates are true?...

qas.question: Hello SAP-team! Which of these statements about overhead rates are true and which are false? - The costing sheet is entered in the master record of the order - Costing sheets consists of base, overhead rate, and credit - Overhead cost elements of type 41 are entered in the rate - The costing sheet is assigned at controlling area level and is determined automatically by the system - Only percentage rates are possible for overhead rates ps: thanks to SAP-community! Eugene

answers.text: Hi, Which of these statements about overhead rates are true and which are false? - The costing sheet is entered in the master record of the order- True - Costing sheets consists of base, overhead rate, and credit-True - Overhead cost elements of type 41 are entered in the rate-True - The costing sheet is assigned at controlling area level and is determined automatically by the system- I think false. Generally cost sheet is defined independently and assigned either thru costing variant or thru orders. - Only percentage rates are possible for overhead rates- False. Qty based is also possible Regards Sudhakar Reddy Edited by: Sudhakar Reddy K.V. on Sep 15, 2009 11:27 AM

data.title: Std SAP report which shows Ordinary vs. Special Depr by Asset

qas.question: Hi Friends , Can some one tell me if there is any std SAP report in FI_AA whihc gives Ordinary vs. Special Depr by Asset . Any inputs greatly appreciated, Ty.

answers.text: use "OARP" to get the report. under OARP got to "Depreciation lists" class and you have all these RABIKA01 Depreciation Comparison RAGAFA01 Posted Depreciation RAHAFA01 Depreciation RAHAFA_A Depreciation RAIDPL19 Fixed Asset Ledger RAKAFA_A Depreciation and Interest RAMAFA_A Manual Depreciation RASIMU02 Depreciation Simulation use report "RABIKA01 Depreciation Comparison" in the report select the option "Display special depreciation types separately" and this helps as follows If this indicator is set, the report displays the following different depreciation types separately: o ordinary depreciation o special depreciation o unplanned depreciation o transfer of reserves

data.title: Read orders which are not technical complete in custom report

qas.question: Hi, what do you recommend to read all orders which are not from status "technical complete" in a custom report. Is there a function module to acchieve this with good performance or what do you recommend? Thanks a lot. Kind regards Manfred.

answers.text: Hi Manfred, Since you asked about a function module for use in a custom report, it is likely that you are not looking to use a standard transaction to display the orders. The phase of a maintenance order can be found from the field AFIH-IPHAS, where the phases are: 0 Outstanding 1 Postponed (currently not used) 2 Released 3 Technically completed 4 Manual deletion indicator set 5 Historical order 6 Completed for business (from 4.6) So to find non-technical complete - you would select where iphas not equal to 3. If you need to make this selection RFC capable, then you can wrap it in a RFC capable function module Regards Andrew

data.title: Which SAP Module in R/3 can replace Peoplesoft?

qas.question: Hey Experts, I would like to know which SAP R/3 module is best suited to be implemented in a Construction Company? This Company is already into PeopleSoft..I mean to know which SAP Module can replace peoplesoft for this construction industry...Is SAP Business One suitable for this sector? Regards Ashim

answers.text: Hi Ashim I suppose I should read the entire message first before replying. When you talk about construction companies, it is necessary to delve deeper into what the expectations of the customer will be. What type of construction are we talking about? Project based? What time frames to construct? Number of stock codes, complexity of BOMs, transaction volumes. There is a lot to consider. Could you give more details and we can guide you better. Kind regards Peter Juby

data.title: CDS Views: get additional records which don't match filter value

qas.question: I have an ABAP program I am attempting to emulate in a CDS view. The program will filter on a key field (VBELN) then pull in any additional records that are marked as "default" (default meaning that they should always display on the results). The link between the record that matches on VBELN and the default record is another field, GRPFILTER. Example from ABAP: RecordID Filter DefaultFlg vbeln1 grpfilter vbeln2 grpfilter X vbeln3 grpfilter vbeln4 grpfilter2 Display report where RecordID = vbeln1 Results: vbeln1 vbeln2 Original ABAP code pulls all data for RecordID, vbeln1. Then pulls all data from the same Filter, grpfilter, where the defaultFlg is true. ---------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------- How do I do this in a CDS view? I can get the records associated by the Filter, but when I say filter on VBELN at the display point, the default records are dropped. CDS Results Example: vbeln1 vbeln2 vbeln3 (all records with Filter = grpfilter) Filter where RecordID = vbeln1 Expected results: vbeln1 vbeln2 <==RecordID vbeln2 has defaultFlg = true) Actual results: vbeln1 <==RecordID vbeln2 is filtered out because it doesn't match the chosen RecordID

answers.text: No accepted solution found

data.title: which table relateds to a specific combobox validValues?

qas.question: i want to know which table is the source of a combobx's validValues? for example: "DateFormat" combobox in display tab in General Setting form under system initializatin fold Note: i know that GetFieldValidValues method of SBOB object can get the value, but i want to know which table it stores? thanks.

answers.text: These values are managed by B1 internally. As you wrote, you access these values by using the SBOB object. If you want to visualize these valid values you could use B1 DB Browser that gives you a complete view of your DB: tables, columns, links, valid values and so on. Note that not all these information are managed by native SQL but can be managed by the B1 application itself. For instance: links between tables are not implemented as foreign keys but managed by the application. This tool is available in either B1DE or B1TE packages. You can download these packages from SDN: go to the B1 SDN home page and navigate into Business One SDK Tools.

data.title: Query help: Items which has been ordered last year (same month)

qas.question: Dear experts, i need your help in a user query containing this information: Docdate has to be the current month, but one year before. Quantity has to be the sum of all same items ordered in this month. All is based on sales orders. I hope, you understand my thoughts😉 😉 Thanks for your help! Sebastian

answers.text: Hi Sebastian, I think there is no meaning of bringing Doc date and Doc num as you need sum of Quantity in your report So i bring Year and Month instead of DocDate and DocNum Please try below query if you need you can use DocDate and DocNum instead of Month of DocDate and Year of Doc date. You may need to change in both select and Group By Area -------- Select Year(A.DocDate)[Year],Month(A.DocDate)[Month], A.CardCode, C.CardName, B.ItemCode, D.ItemName, Sum(B.Quantity) [Qty] From ORDR A Inner Join RDR1 B on A.DocEntry = B.DocEntry and A.Canceled ='N' Inner join OCRD C on A.CardCode = C.CardCode Left Outer Join OITM D on B.ItemCode = D.ItemCode Where Year(GetDate()) - Year(A.DocDate)= 1 and Month(GetDate()) = Month(A.DocDate) Group By Year(A.DocDate),Month(A.DocDate), A.CardCode, C.CardName, B.ItemCode, D.ItemName ------------- Thanks Unnikrishnan

data.title: Charging GST on fair market value which is different value than transaction value

qas.question: I have a situation where we are having a guest house charging concessional rent from employees. However as per GST Act, GST is to be paid on fair market value. For example, we are charging Rs. 100 from employees but fair market value is Rs. 1000. Hence we have to charge GST on Rs. 1000 but we still have to recover from employee only Rs. 500. In standard FI invoice through t code FB70, GST is charged only on the amount which is credited to income GL with tax code. Hence we are crediting Rs. 100/- to income GL with tax code and accordingly GST is charged on Rs. 100/- instead of Rs. 1000. I tried to handle the situation by usting stastical GL by posting following entry through t code FB70: Customer for Guesthouse 100.00 CGST - Payable 90.00- SGST - Payable 90.00- Discount 80.00 no tax code Stat A/C--INC 1,000.00- with Tax code Stat A/C--INC 1,000.00- no tax code This has solved my problem except for generating E invoice through t code edoc_cockpit where taxable value is picked up as Rs. 2080/- instead of Rs. 1000/- Hence please guide how to proceed with the situation - thanks in advance.

answers.text: No accepted solution found

data.title: In a implementation project, which module ( either MM or PP) is implemented

qas.question: Hello PP members: In a implementation project, which module ( either MM or PP) is implemented first. I presume that First FI is done , followed by MM then PP & finally SD Please clarify

answers.text: Eshwer, It is nothing like serial implementation. During Implementation all the modules will be implemented parallely, probably for enterprise structure is the only area where it needs to be done serially as there are dependencies. In that case FICO->MM>SD/PP. Once enterprise structure is created then all modules can be implemented parallely. Regards, Prasobh

data.title: The time at which the PO has got saved

qas.question: Hi Frnd, Can i get the time at which the P.O has got saved , is there any table where i can find the time ??? Or any other option available to see the time ???? REgards Rakesh

answers.text: Hi, if you have version management activated then you can get this information when the PO is created with version 0. if not then goto CDHDR table and give the object value as your PO no. and check for the utime and udate for the PO with tcode me21n. regards, Adwait Bachuwar

data.title: 4.6C--Customization for which NO Transports are generated

qas.question: We are SAP R/3 4.6C. There are transaction/customization for which no transports can be generated . Does anyone have list of transactions/processes which 1)cannot be transported in SAP 4.6c? 2)system needs to be opened up in SAP 4.6c? Please reply at the earliest. Thanks

answers.text: You can see the transport type in SPRO by switching/displaying the transport type (Automatic/Manual). In SPRO choose from the menu Additional Information->Technical Data->Transport Type Number Ranges usually are Manual where you might need to open the client and maintain. Some Manual Transport can be included in workbench requests eg., Validations,Substitutions. Regards Sreenivas

data.title: How to Find Which Classes are Executed at Backend in S/4HANA Public Cloud System?

qas.question: Hi, In order to fix some issues in S/4HANA Cloud system. We'd like to do a debug. But anyone knows how to find which Class/Classes is/are exact the one is/are executed at backend for the frontend apps? Just for example below, if click on “Go” button, some abap code probably in some specific Classes are executed at backend. How can find which Class is exact the one is executed? Thanks & Regards, David

answers.text: No accepted solution found
